title: Replace procedural humans/dogs/furniture with free 3D models and disable character movement

requirements.text: Stop all human movement in the cafe scene by removing the walking customer behavior and any per-frame animation updates affecting human transforms so all humans remain static in place.

quotes: Not moving people just use free 3d models from Google for humans, dogs and table chair sets

acceptanceCriteria: No human character changes position or rotation over time (no walk loops).
The scene renders without using any per-frame animation logic for humans (no HumanCharacter movement/idle animation affecting transforms).
At least the same number of human figures remain visible in the scene as before (seated + standing/waiting equivalent placements).

requirements.text: Replace the current primitive-based human and dog characters with locally bundled, free 3D model assets (GLB/GLTF) sourced via Google search (free-to-use), and load them from the appâ€™s static assets rather than fetching from external URLs at runtime.

quotes: Not moving people just use free 3d models from Google for humans, dogs and table chair sets

acceptanceCriteria: Human and dog visuals come from imported GLB/GLTF files stored under frontend/public (or another frontend-static location) and are not downloaded from Google or any external host at runtime.
The cafe scene shows at least 3 human models and at least 2 dog models placed similarly to the current layout.
Models load successfully with a graceful fallback (the scene still renders if a model fails to load).

requirements.text: Replace the current procedural table and chair components with locally bundled, free 3D table/chair set models (GLB/GLTF) sourced via Google search (free-to-use), and use those models in both the basic fallback room and the full cafe environment furniture layout.

quotes: Not moving people just use free 3d models from Google for humans, dogs and table chair sets

acceptanceCriteria: Tables and chairs visible in BasicCafeRoomFallback and CafeEnvironment render using imported 3D model assets rather than box/cylinder primitive geometry for those items.
Furniture models are placed and scaled so the seating areas remain navigable (no major blocking of the camera corridor).
The build succeeds and the scene renders without runtime errors related to asset loading.

requirements.text: Add a simple attribution/license record for each third-party 3D model used (humans, dogs, tables/chairs), including source URL and license type, and ensure it is included in the repository.

quotes: Not moving people just use free 3d models from Google for humans, dogs and table chair sets

acceptanceCriteria: There is a committed attribution document listing each model, its original source URL, author/creator (if available), and license.
Attribution entries cover: at least one human model source, one dog model source, and one table/chair set source.

constraints: Do not fetch or hotlink 3D models from Google or any external domain at runtime; all models must be bundled as frontend static assets.
Keep the backend as-is; no Motoko canister changes are required for this request.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new gameplay, interactions, or AI behaviors for humans/dogs.
Implementing custom character animation systems (walking cycles, skeletal animation blending, etc.).
Adding third-party authentication or external storage/CDN for assets.

preferencesToAdd: Prefer using free-to-use third-party 3D models for scene assets and keep characters static (no movement).
